vehicles.title: New Glenn
vehicles.description: New Glenn is a two-stage rocket with a diameter of 7 m (23 ft). Its first stage will be powered by seven BE-4 engines that use liquid methane / liquid oxygen as propellants and is designed to be reusable for up to 25 missions. New Glenn is capable of carrying people and payloads to Earth orbit and beyond.

vehicles.title: Space-X Starship
vehicles.description: The Starship spacecraft and Super Heavy rocket, which are collectively known as Starship, form a reusable transport system created by SpaceX that can transport both crew and cargo to Earth's orbit, the Moon, Mars, and other destinations. Starship is anticipated to be the most potent launch vehicle ever designed, capable of transporting up to 150 metric tonnes of reusable cargo to Earth's orbit and up to 250 metric tonnes of expendable cargo.

details.title: Astronaut training
details.description: Before embarking, fliers will have to undergo extensive training. We will provide the necessary training, including zero-gravity simulations, G-force training, lunar surface training, and spacewalk training.

details.title: Luxury accommodation
details.description: While in space, fliers need a place to stay. We will provide comfortable, luxurious accommodations that are equipped with everything fliers need to feel at home.

details.title: Spacewalks
details.description: We offer the chance for fliers to go on spacewalks, allowing them to experience the thrill of floating in space and seeing the Earth from above.

details.title: Personalized meals
details.description: We offer personalized meal plans that cater to the individual needs and preferences of each flier.

details.title: Low-gravity sports
details.description: Fliers can participate in zero-gravity sports, such as zero-gravity basketball or soccer; a fun and unique way to pass the time while in space.

details.title: Entertainment
details.description: We provide in-flight entertainment options for fliers, including movies, books, and games.

details.title: Souvenirs
details.description: Fliers can purchase unique souvenirs, such as personalized space suits, mission patches, or space rocks.

details.title: Post-flight experiences
details.description: We also provide post-flight experiences, such as debriefings and meetings with space experts, to help fliers process their experiences and make the most of their journey.

details.title: Personalized mementos
details.description: To commemorate the experience, We also provide personalized mementos, such as photos, videos, and certificates of participation, available for purchase

journey.title: Training
journey.description: Fliers must undergo Spacecraft training, Zero G training, Low G training, Psychological training and G-Force training
journey.alt: A woman recieiving a space training lesson.

journey.title: Launch
journey.description: Take off from Earth, experiencing 3 Gs of force. This takes around 8-9 minutes, accelerating from 0 to 7,500 m/s.
journey.alt: A rocket taking off from Earth.

journey.title: Orbit Alignment
journey.description: Having taken off, the ship will undergo orbital alignment, experiencing slight G-force shifts as the ship moves and orients itself towards the moon. This takes approximately 2 days
journey.alt: A diagram about orbit alignment.

journey.title: Travel
journey.description: Once oriented, begin moving towards Moon, taking only 1 day
journey.alt: A rocket with its boosters detaching.

journey.title: Landing
journey.description: Once the ship approaches the moon, it will begin decelerating. This process lasts around 13 minutes.
journey.alt: The moon lander as it touches down.

journey.title: Return
journey.description: A 3 day journey from the Moon. This includes a Moon exit burn, Earth atmosphere re-entry, and Earth landing. Passengers will experience a maximum of 6 Gs of force during Earth landing.
journey.alt: A Space-X Starship going through re-entry.

includes: Flight to and from Low Earth Orbit

vehicles.title: Falcon 9
vehicles.description: The Falcon 9 rocket, created and produced by SpaceX, is a two-stage vehicle that is intended to transport individuals into Earth's orbit and beyond in a dependable and secure manner. This rocket is the first reusable rocket in the world capable of orbiting the Earth. The reuse of the Falcon 9 rocket's most costly components helps to reduce the cost of space access.

vehicles.title: Soyuz MS
vehicles.description: The Soyuz MS is a spacecraft designed for crewed spaceflight operations and cargo transport to the International Space Station. It is a modernized version of the Soyuz family of spacecraft and features upgrades and improvements, such as the ability to carry up to three crew members and remain in space for up to 200 days. The Soyuz MS consists of three modules and is launched from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. Its reliability and safety have made it one of the most widely used spacecraft in spaceflight history.

journey.title: Training
journey.description: Fliers must undergo Spacecraft training, Zero G training and G-Force training
journey.alt: A woman recieiving a space training lesson.

journey.title: Launch
journey.description: Take off from Earth, experiencing 3 Gs of force. This takes around 8-9 minutes, accelerating from 0 to 7,500 m/s.
journey.alt: A rocket taking off from Earth.

journey.title: Orbit
journey.description: Spend 3 days being 585 km above Earth while enjoying the activities and anemities Space Oasis provides.
journey.alt: An image of the Earth from Low Earth Orbit.

journey.title: Return
journey.description: The capsule performs a 15 minute de-orbit burn, and then starts atmospheric re-entry after 35-40 minutes. It takes 3 minutse to complete re-entry before splashing down in the Pacific Ocean.
journey.alt: A capsule going through re-entry.

vehicles.title: Space-X Starship
vehicles.description: The Starship spacecraft and Super Heavy rocket, which are collectively known as Starship, form a reusable transport system created by SpaceX that can transport both crew and cargo to Earth's orbit, the Moon, Mars, and other destinations. Starship is anticipated to be the most potent launch vehicle ever designed, capable of transporting up to 150 metric tonnes of reusable cargo to Earth's orbit and up to 250 metric tonnes of expendable cargo.

journey.title: Training
journey.description: Fliers must undergo Spacecraft training, Zero G training and G-Force training, Martian Terrain Training, Low Gravity Training, Cryosleep training.
journey.alt: A woman recieiving a space training lesson.

journey.title: Launch
journey.description: Take off from Earth, experiencing 3 Gs of force. This takes around 8-9 minutes, accelerating from 0 to 7,500 m/s.
journey.alt: A rocket taking off from Earth.

journey.title: Refueling
journey.description: To sustain the aircraft for the journey to mars, another Starship will launch and meet the ship, depositing all of its fuel.
journey.alt: One Starship supplying fuel to another Starship.

journey.title: Orbit Alignment
journey.description: Having taken off, the ship will undergo orbital alignment, experiencing slight G-force shifts as the ship moves and orients itself towards Mars. This process will continue throughout the flight.
journey.alt: A diagram about orbit alignment.

journey.title: Travel
journey.description: Once en route to Mars, passengers can choose to spend the 3 months on-flight in cryosleep, or awake while enjoying the activities and features Starship has to offer
journey.alt: A rocket with its boosters detaching.

journey.title: Landing
journey.description: Starship will enter Mar's atmosphere and perform aerodynamic braking. After reaching an altitude of 2 km, the ship will rotate to propulsively brake and land vertically on the surface of Mars.
journey.alt: A futuristic base where Starships would land on Mars.

journey.title: Return
journey.description: Fliers will have the opportunity to experience the same in-flight amenities as before, and swiftly reach Earth
journey.alt: A Space-X Starship going through re-entry.

journey.title: Post-Flight Rehabilitation
journey.description: After returning to Earth, fliers will undergo physical training and monitoring to get their bodies readjusted to Earth's gravity and climate
journey.alt: A woman exiting the capsule.

details.title: Astronaut training
details.description: Before embarking, fliers will have to undergo extensive training. We will provide the necessary training, including zero-gravity simulations, G-force training, low-gravity training, cryosleep training, martian surface training, and spacewalk training.

details.title: Luxury accommodation
details.description: While in space, or on Mars, fliers need a place to stay. We will provide comfortable, luxurious accommodations that are equipped with everything fliers need to feel at home.

details.title: Spacewalks
details.description: We offer the chance for fliers to go on spacewalks, allowing them to experience the thrill of floating in space and seeing the Earth from above.

details.title: Personalized meals
details.description: We offer personalized meal plans that cater to the individual needs and preferences of each flier.

details.title: Entertainment
details.description: We provide in-flight entertainment options for fliers, including movies, books, and games.

details.title: Souvenirs
details.description: Fliers can purchase unique souvenirs, such as personalized space suits, mission patches, or space rocks.

details.title: Post-flight experiences
details.description: We also provide post-flight experiences, such as debriefings and meetings with space experts, to help fliers process their experiences and make the most of their journey.

details.title: Personalized mementos
details.description: To commemorate the experience, We also provide personalized mementos, such as photos, videos, and certificates of participation, available for purchase

details.title: Dust Surfing
details.description: Take an exhilarating ride over the powerful winds and currents of Martian dust.

details.title: Mars Hike
details.description: Explore the Martian terrain and landscapes on a rover or by foot, visit and study geological features such as canyons, mountains, and valleys.

details.title: Cave Exploration
details.description: Experience a thrilling adventure that reveals the secrets of what lies under the surface of the Red Planet.

details.title: ATV Ride
details.description: Explore the tough terrains and craters of mars on your own ATV's

details.title: Cryosleep
details.description: NASA's Torpor Inducing Transfer Habitat For Human Stasis works by putting passengers to sleep for extended periods of time, lowering metabolic rates extensively, preserving their body for the journey
